meanings.definition: A priest in ancient Rome dedicated to a specific deity.
meanings.sent1: The flamines performed rituals at the temple.
meanings.sent2: In ancient Rome, people respected the flamines for their religious duties.
meanings.sent3: The flamines accidentally mixed up the ceremonial robes and wore them backward.
meanings.sent4: The flamines were like bridges between the people and the gods.
meanings.sent5: The colorful attire of the flamines made them stand out during ceremonies.

meanings.definition: Plural form of 'flamen', referring to multiple priests in ancient Rome.
meanings.sent1: Many flamines gathered at the sacred site for the festival.
meanings.sent2: The flamines chanted together during the sacred rituals.
meanings.sent3: The flamines decided to have a friendly competition to see who could recite the prayers the fastest.
meanings.sent4: The unity among the flamines was as strong as the marble pillars of the temple.
meanings.sent5: The harmonious voices of the flamines echoed through the temple halls.
